meanings.definition: To act together or in conjunction with another
meanings.sent1: The friends coacted to clean up the park.
meanings.sent2: The team coacted to finish the project on time.
meanings.sent3: The siblings coacted to surprise their parents with a homemade dinner.
meanings.sent4: The birds coacted to build a nest in the tree.
meanings.sent5: The students coacted to organize a charity event for the community.

meanings.definition: To work together towards a common goal
meanings.sent1: The neighbors coacted to plant trees in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The countries coacted to address the global issue.
meanings.sent3: The animals coacted to outsmart the hunter in the forest.
meanings.sent4: The ants coacted to carry the food back to their nest.
meanings.sent5: The children coacted to build a sandcastle at the beach.
